Title:
I have been compelled to join TripAdvisor just to write this review. To give some background, this flight only had 8 passengers and was travelling from Seychelles to Male, Maldives - a 3 hour flight duration.

Around 45 minutes into my flight I pressed the service button to ask for some water. After 25 minutes of waiting I walked to the back of the plane in search of water to find 2 cabin crew covered up with blankets ASLEEP ( see photos). There were no other crew present in the economy cabin for the duration of the flight. I could freely wander the cabin, access doors etc with zero supervision at the rear of the aircraft.

With 1 hour remaining the sleeping crew woke up and went to the empty business class cabin, closed the curtains and enjoyed breakfast with the rest of their colleagues. I peered through the curtains in disbelief. When I saw they were eating a croissant in addition to their continental breakfast I asked if I could have one for my son. I was told they were for the captain only and the cabin crew had taken a few of his stash.

Air Seychelles left a lot to be desired, awful service and unsafe experience.

DO NOT FLY AIR SEYCHELLES IT IS UNSAFE.
crvsd: Holly S wrote a review Oct 2022

Title:
I would strongly advise anyone traveling to the Seychelles to avoid this airline. We booked flights for our honeymoon more than four months in advance, and were shocked to discover that Air Seychelles changed our flight time at the last minute by 10 hours, without notifying us directly. The first "notice" they gave us of the change was a generic "Flight Reminder" email four days before the trip, which did not explicitly note the time change. There was no text message or separate email noting the change, and by then it was too late to change our plans.

We've been struggling to get a refund from the airline, and they seem to have no interest in acknowledging or correcting their mistake. I've never had another airline change a flight time by so much -- from evening to morning -- without explicitly notifying passengers.

For travel to the Seychelles, I'd strongly recommend taking Emirates instead. We were forced to buy last-minute tickets at the airport, but they were incredibly helpful and kind in dealing with an unpleasant travel interruption.
crvsd: Harrison S wrote a review Sep 2022
qwuub: Horrific service from an airline that doesn't seem to care about its passengers

Title: I travel regularly on this flight since more than 2 decades, and I am happy to start reviewing my experience on TripAdvisor to give more echoe to my experience. Air Seychelles may not be as big and pompous airline as the others, but it is the sweetest with one of the best customer services. Check In was seamless at Mauritius airport with Jessen and his team offering a most helpful and smiling service. The flight itself was stress free with a very professional Cabin Crew. Jerris was a very able Head of Crew onboard and was not only looking after the Business Class passengers (as it so often happens on other fights) but came back to chat with the Economy passengers, having a nice word for each one. Tessy was simply lovely always with a smile and well-wishing gesture. She was so attentive to details and was so natural in her approach that everyone felt so much at ease. Christopher, the young steward at the rear of the cabin was as helpful and available as Tessy. Keep it up guys, you are showing to all your other colleagues and your hierarchy that being a Cabin Crew member is not just to open and close the door, not just to be ostentatious and far-reaching, not being big-headed and unreachable. Keep on being simple, courteous and human. I hope that the Management of Air Seychelles recognises that the Cabin Crew is the real shop window of the company and that in the thrive to take off from the major crisis it was in just months ago, that the importance of the Cabin Crew is vital to this redress and that they need encouragement, better work conditions and a better treatment.

Title:

Title:
We were booked on a one-way flight from Praslin to Mauritius (PRI-SEZ-MRU). The checkin in Praslin was pretty smooth. The lady told us that our baggage is directed to Mauritius, nothing to worry about on Mah√©. Great news!

After arrival we had to checkin again as the second flight was international. At the counter I mentioned casually that we only have two backpacks as carry on as our checked baggage is transferred to Mauritius. "No that is not possible" we were told. "You have to pick it up at the baggage claim and check it in again." After some discussions I went back. Luckily a met a couple from the UK that did the same trip as we did. Same problem there.

We found an Air Seychelles employee, explained the situation, gave her our baggage tags we got earlier at Praslin and followed her back to the counter. They were having an argue. Unbelievable. Both flights operated by one airline that does not know their internal procedures and processes. After we were told that the baggage is transferred to Mauritius - surprise surprise - the real problems began as my girlfriend was traveling with her wheelchair that comes with electrically powered wheels.

We showed them the necessary IATA certificates and technical specs as we always do in that situation around the globe with many airlines. Airlines are generally not pleased to transport batteries in the cargo area due to potential risk of fire. But in this case the batteries are an integrated part of the wheels. You cannot take them off without taking off both wheels completely. So as usual they checked everything and let us finally continue. So far so good.

After boarding was finished the captain announced that we were actually early some minutes. Great news again. But suddenly the lady from the check-in appeared at our seats to tell us that the wheelchair will not be transported by Air Seychelles because an approval was missing. What the...?!

We had no idea what she meant. As I already wrote we had shown them the papers. And by the way we had sent the all the documents five days ahead of the flight as requested by Air Seychelles. We never got a reply to that email.

They still insisted an approval was missing. Just to mention again: No issues with the same airline on the first flight segment before...

However three to four employees were discussing at the aircraft's door. After 30 minutes the captain explained the situation to all passengers via speaker. He said they are organizing the missing approval and are waiting for it. Again: What missing approval and how are they organizing it by themselves when the complained that we did not bring the approval. Simply does not make sense at all.

After an hour I accidentally could observe a guy walking right next to the aircraft carrying the wheelchair's wheels with the batteries. Minutes later we took off without further information.

After arrival in Mauritius we found the wheelchair in parts lying on the floor in front of the special baggage counter. Some idiots bent one of the shafts that connect the wheels to the chassis. Without any tools and with pure force I could barely fix the shaft. Otherwise our trip had ended at this point.

We have never ever experienced that kind of discrimination against people with disabilities anywhere on the globe. Totally unprofessional and completely intolerable.

The Seychelles are probably the most beautiful places we have ever seen on earth but Air Seychelles is a catastrophe. Shame on you!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
We flew from Mahe to Praslin at 3pm in one of their tiny plane.
As the plane was full, they could not bring all the passengers luggage on the plane.
When we reached in Praslin, they told us that the luggage would arrive by the next flight we had to wait for...
On the next plane, no sign of our luggage.
They then said, you should wait for the next one, meaning another 30 minutes wait in the heat of Praslin airport.
I suggested them to ring to see if our luggage would indeed be onboard.
They apparently tried, but could not reach anyone.
As you may well expect, still no luggage in this second plane.
They finally told us we should go and would deliver the luggage to our hotel, but could not tell us when...
At worst at 9pm on the last flight.
To top it all, you have to leave with them your original ticket receipt, so you are actually left with no proof that you even had some luggage with them.
People in Praslin airport were not helpful and did not really care much about the situation.
As Seychelles tries to promote high-end tourism they should also gear their national airline to this level !
Finally got our luggage after 7pm.
Spoilt our firs afternoon in Praslin as stuck in our jeans and shirt, not adapted really to the climate.

Title: We flew Air Seychelles on the 18th September, flight HM 1124 and then back to South Africa from Maldives with Flight HM123 on the 26th September 2021. We opted for Air Seychelles to travel to the Male, Maldives as it was a direct flight (9 hours) with just a refueling stop in Mahe, Seychelles as opposed to the long layover flights elsewhere.The takeoff and landings were pretty good but that was all that was good about this airline. Having travelled with the big 3 Middle Eastern airlines, I know what good customer service is about and where Air Seychelles was just down right bad.Things to improve/were not good and tips:‚Ä¢            Communication! There was no heads up or communication from either Air Seychelles or my travel agent, that passengers needed to bring headsets in order to watch movies on your OWN DEVICE ÔÅä Considering this was a 9 hour flight, it was just unreal that this wasn‚Äôt communicated and most people couldn‚Äôt even access or watch anything either because of no headphones or the wifi on board for streaming was terrible!P.S Please bring with you headphones as you‚Äôll be bored over 9 hours!‚Ä¢            The food! As many have mentioned, the food quality was terrible and it happened to us 3 times, where we sat in the first few rows(1st flight) and the middle row (2nd flight) and by the time the food service came, there was only one option left. This happened 3 times and not once did the cabin crew try and serve people who missed out the first time first, in order to have a choice! They couldn‚Äôt even meet dietary requirements!!‚Ä¢            The flight back to South Africa from Maldives (HM123 on the 26th September 2021), was delayed for more than 2 hours and the airline didn't even provide any meal vouchers like the other airlines  did. Extremely disappointing!‚Ä¢            The cabin crew are poorly trained and have little customer service etiquette. On our trip from JHB to Male via Mahe, our seats that were booked to sit together as a couple couldn‚Äôt be fulfilled? We had to then sit on opposite sides of an aisle and were promised that when the plane lands in Mahe for refueling, we‚Äôd get the seats that a couple who were getting off in Mahe. Title:
Dreadful Customer Service

I booked a ticket with Air Seychelles via their own website on August 3, 2021 from Johannesburg to Seychelles. For the leg JNB to SEZ I booked a restricted business class (P) while on the flight back SEZ to JNB I booked a fully flexible business class ticket (J class).

An hour into the booking when I wanted to confirm the hotel, I had to find out that the last hotel room at the hotel was booked / sold out and only significantly more expensive suites were available. I hence emailed customer service 1 hr after the booking was made to request if the ticket would be refunded. In europe but also the US it is common practice that within 24 hrs, even for restricted economy fares, airlines have a grace period where you can refund any ticket booked. airlines need as a matter of fact by regulation allow either a free of cost reservation for 24 hrs or alternatively refund tickets within 24 hrs free of charge or penalties.

I got an email back from Customer Service (Kelly) stating that the ticket would be allowed to rebook but that the refund value would only be 41 Euro of approx. 1.500 Euro ticket price. I replied back that while I appreciate the offer, I do not wish to rebook the ticket but would ask to refund the ticket or partially refund the ticket in J Class which was flexible.

I did not get a reply - not to my follow up email from August 3 nor from August 4, 5, 6. What is worse is that the airline phone number +248 4 391 000 is not reachable from Germany.

Independent of this, the airline states in its refund policy: Refunds may take up to 6 months to process. - this tells you a lot about the airline financial situation.

I can only advise travellers NOT to book with Air Seychelles and use alternative carriers instead - the practices demonstrated are against what other airlines practice. The fact of not responding to inquires and not being reachable is not acceptable to me.

From previous travel with Air Seychelles I can also confirm that the airline seats and service definitely are far behind those offered by other airlines serving this beautiful destination such as Emirates, Etihad or others.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I have contacted the airline and have received no response except that my bag is considered minor damage and they will not take responsibility, so this is to ensure that everyone is well educated before using an airline that does not care for your health, safety or belongings:
I would like to bring to your attention our experience with Air Seychelles. This was our first time using the airline and we were quite excited for our journey to a once in a lifetime trip to the Maldives.
Unfortuantly our expectations were not only not met but they were way below sub-standard.
I spent 5 years working in the airline industry for a global airline and feel the service recieved was not up to par.
Firstly we were informed that we would be staying on the aircraft in transit from Seychelles to Maldives but once on board the aircraft this was not the case, which was not an issue as I understand we were to go to the transit lounge while the aircraft was cleaned. we had onward tickets already and informed our luggage would be passed through.
Our first shall we call it a hiccup, happened when we were escorted to the transit terminal. Understandably they need to check documentation but at this stage we were herded into a room with no ventilation or aircon and made to stand for nearly 2 hours since the "system" was offline, during this time passengers with children were allowed to go through and their passports were taken but for the rest of us we had to just stand and wait in a terribly hot room with no toilet or water access after a 5 hour flight, once we eventually got the front it seems as the tickets that were issued were no longer to be used. We then managed to get through and our flight was boarding well past it's intially take off time meaning we were late to our arrivals. also once through there was no time to get something to drink or use the lavatories since the plane was already boarding and low and behold nothing was communicated to the parents who had previously gone through nor that the flight would not leave with out them. I thought this is just a snag and covid policies dragging out the process but a little aircon, water and some communication on what is happening goes a long way.
Once arrival from a 2 hour boat trip to our hotel and after checkin I went to unlock my bag and it had been broken into, once I checked all contents noticed a pair of sunglasses were removed from their case and all my belongings rifled through.
Since it was only the lock that was popped and the luggage sealed I never noticed on arrival.
I then emailed my travel agent and once I recieved her reply to contact the airline I did so.
After confirming your policy on the website to report at the airport or report after leaving the airport as per below from your website:
"If you discover that your baggage and/or its contents are damaged and report it prior to leaving the airport, you will be in possession of a Damage Property Report (DPR). If you report it after leaving the airport, please contact Air Seychelles in writing, along with supporting documents within 7 days of arrival. We will assess the claim and notify you accordingly. For any baggage enquiries, please contact your local baggage services office on mhlbag@airseychelles.com"
Apperently this process hasn't been communicated to the staff since the refused to help me with this report as "it can only be done at the airport"
Since my last communication with them on Tuesday 15 December 2020 there has been no furthur feedback and this causes a great issue as I can neither claim from my insurance for the damaged bag nor the sunglasses.
In addition to this the journey home was not a pleasant experience as once again the "system" in the transit lounge didn't work making the flight delayed upwards of 2 hours meaning we landed back in South Africa after curfew making people nervous to travel home. there was once again no communication in transit on what was going on, no ventilation in the room and then we received 2 handwritten tickets for separated seats. Why the booking was not done all the way through to Johannesburg from Maldives astounds me but now I was angry. I then got revised seats but when on the plane there were rows available at the back. Also we were advised the last 2 rows were blocked out for quarantine which is fine if they were actually used, since we found out on landing in South Africa that there were indeed Covid positive cases on the plane not 2 rows away from us, putting us all at risk without informing anyone. I must say I am highly disgusted with the service received and extremely disappointed with the airline baggage and ground staff. The lack of communication and feedback is unacceptable and the lack of accountability for the luggage and non compliance with their own COVID policies is extremely scary. I worry if this same complacency is put into place with their safety and security protocols
I definitely do not recommend using them for transit to anywhere since all our transit experiences were terrible. Maybe it‚Äôs better if you just fly to Maldives but with the luggage and covid issues I would use the airline again

qwuub: Once in a lifetime trip ruined

Title:
Air seyshelles

We flew from Johannesburg to seyshelles Mahe in March. It‚Äôs a brilliant direct flight that takes about 5 hours. Great price off season at ZAR 9000 per person return. The downside it‚Äôs a badly timed flight that leaves SA at 2pm and arrives in Mahe, the main island at 9pm local time ( note there is a 3 hour time difference). To make matters worse it leave Mahe at 9am to sa. This means you looose 2 days of you island vacation for which you have to pay for accommodation. It baffles me why they would do this and wish they would change the scheduling to give passages best value for money.

The plane to seyshelles was old and dated. The tv screen don‚Äôt work, some seat panels were missing, cramped economy seats and toilets felt old. The return trip on A320-251N was the new plane and much better feel.

They don‚Äôt have tv anymore but your can loggon to seystream to steam movies to your phone. So make sure you have a fully charged phone and earphones.

Food is basic and I suppose ok for a 5 hour flight.

All in all, an ok airline for the benefit of the direct flight. Would use them again.

Title:
Whilst the flight itself was good, despite being some 30 minutes late in arriving at JNB, arrived on time in Seychelles. The food offered was excellent and Air Seychelles is to be commended for that but, all else disappointing:
- Only offered one drink throughout the whole five hour flight.
- Legroom poor and worse than on the older A.320.
- Seats less comfortable than on the older A.320.
- The Wi-Fi IFE streaming is a disaster! They say you can use a laptop - just try it. OK for a smartphone or small tablet but the seating pitch is so tight, anything else is impractical.
- How irritating to be asked for an opinion of the the Wi-Fi service in the middle of the film you are watching the options are: take survey now, remind me later or No Thanks - none worked. The screen froze - never got more than a third into the film I was trying to watch. Never could reconnect again for the rest of the flight!
- Discussed with cabin crew who said that they have had endless complaints both on our flight but also on a number of other flights.
- Air Seychelles have made a bad choice with their IFE in an effort to cut costs.
- I pity a family of four who, unless they know beforehand, for ALL of them to have tablets, the five hour flight will be a grim experience for them and fellow passengers.
Very disappointing - pity it is the only non-stop service. Not recommended.

Title:
Like many international airlines the aircraft was clean with a well maintained interior. This said, the aircraft was a few months old.
In-flight service could be much better. Entertainment is extremely limited, seats not very comfortable,
Most of all, the attendants were slow, it felt like an eternity before the meals were served, and longer before the trays were cleared. Food servings well below what I expected; more likened to a domestic short haul flight.
On a long haul flight in a narrow body or single isle aircraft with a single set of bathrooms to the rear, it was frustrating seeing the crew oblivious to the more than a dozen passengers standing in a queue behind them while they continued their work at what I can only describe as a snails pace, only allowing us through once they had packed away and stowed the food carts; bear in mind that some of the queuing passengers were children.
I wondered how much better an Emirates or Etihad crew would make this airline!
Staff are the ambassadors of a business.
The passenger next to me asked for a cup of coffee... the cup was handed to her in one hand and the creamer, sugar and stirring stick in the other; a better attendant would have placed all the above on the open seat tray.
Small things make a good airline into a great airline!

Air Seychelles is a budget airline - very cramped seats ( and I am not tall at all). The food was very nice but took very long to be served. All drinks are served by glass and not by the bottle/can due to space restrictions on the aircraft. With turbulance that can be tricky and I was forced to down my drink! No coffee or tea was offered unless asked for individually. No drinks/water was offered during the rest of the flight (unless asked for). Entertainment: None. Have a new wifi system that you can play through your own devices, which does not work all the time, I had to restart my phone and log in all over again 3 times during one movie. Very frustrating so bring your own reading material/movies. It did not work on my husband's laptop either. Only 2 toilets were available for 120 plus passengers. VERY small space. Business-class: won't waste my money as the only difference is a bit more leg space. I am sure the food and service might be better as well. It is the only direct flight to Seychelles so we don't really have a choice! We also could not check-in online the day before.

I flew a lot in my life so it's not my first time if you are wondering!
crvsd: Liana J wrote a review Oct 2019

Title:
Our inbound flight to Mumbai went off without a hitch. I was actually in full praise of the airline as the flight from Johannesburg was broken up nicely with the small stop in the Seychelles. However, our return flight was a complete mess!
We were scheduled to depart Mumbai at 05:45 on 17 March. This meant we needed to arrive at the airport by 3am which we promptly did only to be told once we're at the airport that our flight has been cancelled. No explanation given, we were just told we'll be leaving the next day. The airline put us up at a nearby hotel but throughout the day there was not a single bit of communication except that we were going to be picked up at 23:30 for a flight leaving at 05:45 the next day (that meant an over 6 hour wait at the airport).
I had to chase after the airline via Facebook messages and emails, eventually to be told that we will have a further 24 hour delay once we reach the Seychelles! In total that meant a 48 hour delay! 2 completely wasted days!
The ground staff in Mumbai were exceptionally rude especially when it came to requesting the wheelchair for my Dad. They insisted I did not book it which was not the case because it went very smoothly on our inbound flight. They didn't rebook it when they changed our flight, just like they didn't update our meal preferences. All ok in the haste of the delayed flight but do not stand there and insist your passenger is incorrect.
Delays happen but when it is such a lengthy delay, the least you can do is keep your passengers informed without them having to chase after you. It's an already stressful situation (we didn't know when we'd get home) and Air Seychelles did nothing to ease the minds of their passengers.
And lastly, eventually, when we're on the flight the home, there was not an utterance of an apology.
I will never fly Air Seychelles again!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I accept that a flight is delayed and that I would want the plane to be in premium condition before I board. I accept that the airline would put you up at the hotel whilst the delay is occurring. I accept that any costs incurred as a result of the delay should be borne by the airline, and they have reimbursed me.

What I don't accept, is shoddy service from service personnel....that at 2 hours before the flight have the audacity to tell me that they are just messengers and that I must contact Air Seychelles directly. I do not accept that whilst they are wearing the blazers of Air Seychelles, that they say that they are not responsible; that I cannot ask what their names are; that I cannot take pictures or record their conversation; that they will call the police should I take videos of their conversation with me..... and much much more!

Although Air Seychelles was kind enough to reimburse me for costs incurred, Apart from the painful poor pathetic Indian service (I am a South African Indian), I lost a day in the Seychelles which cannot be reimbursed. It tainted my whole 2 day stay after that and will not go back, unless I get paid first class tickets.
qwuub: Indian ground staff should not wear Air Seychelles blazers
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
I would advise everyone not to use Air Seychelles. I had the most terrible experience with them on my trip to the Seychelles.

Firstly my ankle was broken and my foot in a moon boat and they couldn't have given a damn. I asked if I could move to a seat with extra legroom and was just told that I could pay to upgrade to business class if I like. Not to mention that I had to wait in the queue like everyone else when boarding.

Our flight was delayed by over an hour. Fair enough. But when I arrived in Seychelles I waited for my luggage and it did not arrive. I had to go to lost luggage and deal with a very rude lady who told me that my luggage was left in Johannesburg and would be on the flight the following evening and be delivered to me in La Digue the next day.

So the day arrives that my luggage was supposed to be delivered and guess what no luggage. My mother phones the number they gave me and guess you can't get through to it.

After I eventually get though I have to deal with another rude person who tells me that they don't know where my luggage is and all they can do is send an email to Johannesburg. After this they put the phone down on me.

My luggage eventually arrive on the 5 day after my mother has phoned the OR Tambo and told them to check there email. No-one had checked the email. I had to spend to much off my spending money on buying clothes.

Air Seychelles made the first few days of my holiday a nightmare. Please don't use them. They don't care about their passengers.
crvsd: Penny B wrote a review Jan 2019
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This review only concerns the Air Seychelles ground staff in Mah√© - we did not fly with them but with Turkish Airlines. However, the experience with the ground staff was so extraordinarily bad that it deserves comment.

Long lines of waiting people in front of the check-in-desks when four ladies from Air Seychelles ground staff finally arrived. Starting up the computers was a lengthy process and in the end there were major problems with printers so only some people got boarding passes. Fine, this happens sometimes. But usually things can be smoothed over if staff is kind and polite, explain why there are delays and so on. These ladies screamed at passengers, waved angrily in the air when passengers asked questions and generally ignored people. Quite extraordinary. I didn't see the lady at business check-in behave any better. In the end we were left without boarding passes for our connection (which caused major problems in Istanbul later on) and no apology. We were first at check in and the process took us just over half an hour. I think Turkish Airlines should make a formal complaint to Air Seychelles and say that they expect their cutomers not to be treated like cattle.
qwuub: Ground staff need to learn some manners

Title:
While flying from Mauritius to Mumbai via Mahe, we found that HM260 from Mahe to Mumbai was cancelled on 01.11.18.
The Airline decided to put us up at Mahe & also promised to take care of our onward domestic flight bookings from Mumbai. Details of our bookings were handed over & we were sitting thus pretty, waiting for them to take all necessary action.
While checking in on the next day (02.11.18), we were abruptly told that the onward bookings were our own liability & the airline was in no way concerned with that. This was a shock to all of us.
This resulted in loss for every passenger since by that time, it was too late to take any action to change our onward domestic bookings on our own, the flights having already left.
A more professional approach telling us that we should contact the respective airlines for changing dates of onward flights could have helped in minimizing individual losses.
qwuub: Good. Friendl but Casual. Could improve professional attitude.

Title: I'm standing in the Abu Dhabi airport at 3:04 AM having been told I couldn't get on my flight to London because they rescheduled my flight to the next day because in their opinion I would have not been able to make my connection to London. That means I now miss my flight from London to LA and miss my son's election night which is the whole reason for my trip.  I will forfeit $1,500 for my round trip to LA, $600 for three nights of hotels and miss my son's election night.  Ethiad says they can't do anything even though the  itinerary is listed as Etihad Air Seychelles.  They don't have a call center so there is no way to reach them.  There is another family that the same thing happened to with two little kids crying.  Seychelles compensation for this is a meal voucher - no alcohol.  Never ever fly Ethiad code shares or Air Seychelles.  This is a complete screw job because Air Seychelles wanted to save the $500 that Ethiad would have charged them if I missed the flight which would only have happened if they hadn't been thirty minutes late taking off because they were waiting for three passengers in Mahe. Title:

Title: I was flying to Johannesburg from Mumbai in Air Seychelles and I cannot believe that the airline is a partner with Etihad. The ground staff at Seychelles is inefficient and incapable of resolving any queries of the travelers. They take 45 minutes to check you in and issue a boarding pass. Further, the airport is small and not clean, hence it only makes sense to travel through Air Seychelles if you are staying in Seychelles. If you are traveling elsewhere, avoid this route as there are a lot of flight cancellations. My flight was cancelled and there was no solution offered for the same. They did not provide any assistance with regard to the ticket and connecting flights. The ground staff promised us a refund on the new tickets that we had to purchase and gave us a 'wrong' and 'non existent' email address to write on for the refund. No refund will be issued and there was no response from the team as well. Air Seychelles has a long history of flight cancellations which will disrupt your travel plans if you have connecting flights. If you are headed to Seychelles only, you have no choice but to opt for this flight. The food served in the flight is pathetic and the in flight entertainment is below average. You can look for a different airline for this cost. It is not value for money, not value for your time. Avoid!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: My mother was very unwell post the loss of my father. She had fallen ill while on a trip to India and I had flown in to stabilise her and then fly her to SA to ensure she would build up her strength to be able to eventually fly back to her home in the US. The staff on board were supportive for the 1st sector but beyond awful on the 2nd sector from Mahe to Johannesburg. They did not help her board despite her being on a wheelchair brought on board via a skylift. They ignored her plea to eat at a different time to everyone else on board even though the long flight would have not presented a problem to accede to this request. The senior staff member sat in full view of passengers, did no service whatsoever and ater her meal timeously. Only one relatively inexperienced crew member did all the service and so  seemed to become aware near the end of a 4hr flight that my mother was a severely unwell passenger. This had me very worried when after 2 months she was going to do the return journey from Jnb to Bom via Mahe on her own. I sent a message to HQ in Mahe about my complaint, had a response from HO and my mother had a very attentive and caring crew on her flight back. We all make mistakes but remedying a mistake takes strong management and empathy. Thank you Air Seychelles staff - at Head Office, and crew in the air and on the ground!
qwuub: Remedial action post complaint results in exemplary service
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
First the positives. Very helpful and friendly staff who did their best under trying circumstances. Food was good quality. Staff at the head office in the Seychelles helpfully transacted my extra luggage payment prior to departure.

The negatives. Our flight from Abu Dhabi was delayed by 4 hours. The cabin was cramped and definitely not the standard you would expect from an international airline. There was not enough space to store all hand luggage. In fact many items were stored under peoples feet or was stowed in the food cabin loosely at the back of the plane.

Warning: check your luggage allowance before leaving. We had no idea that we were only allowed 1 item up to 23kg per person. We had to buy an extra 20kg for 80 US Dollars. This would have been double the cost had we found out at the airport. We had to call Seychelles head office in Mahe to purchase it.

Many people missed flight connections because of the delay and emails were sent out too late for people to change plans before arrival at the airport.

The airline only has 2 internationally capable aeroplanes which is two A330-200 planes. There is no way that this airline can claim the same international standard that most passengers would expect.

In a nutshell, Air Seychelles is cheap but you get what you pay for - a no frills airline - perfect if you want to travel to the Seychelles on holiday. But I would not recommend this airline if you are in transit to somewhere. More than likely you will miss connecting flights elsewhere. It is definitely not recommended as a flight to take young children with you.
crvsd: Denzil C wrote a review Jul 2018
qwuub: Fly Air Seychelles only if you holiday there!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Air Seychelles has decided (for a long time) to stop this year in April 2018 their direct connexion with Paris and all the long distance flights from Europe. They work already with Etihad for several years and all the long flights will pass by Abu Dhabi in the future.
That's why maybe the service was a bit lower in the last months and year.
Air Seychelles will concentrate its activity in the local flights (which are very practical and not so expensive).
You must know that the competition will be more active in the next years to go to the Seychelles from Europe : you'll find a new connection with Air France from Paris, a new one with British airways. And always connexion via Emirates, Etihad and Turkish airlines so check all the lines !
About the flight itself, Etihad which takes now the Air Seychelles flights have not the quality of Emirates for example. But the flight between Mah√© and Abu Dhabi is surprising because you have large place for your legs in economy class. It's not usual.
For the rest, normal quality for the food, for the welcome...
qwuub: Air Seychelles stops its long flight from Europe.

Title:
When returning from Praslin for our flight back home, we chose to fly to make sure we made it on time and did not have to spend a lot of time on transfer on Mahe.
We feel it was a good choice, especially since the actual trip was an experience in itself.

The plane is small but feels very safe - and I have a fear of flying, I never flew something this small before. The logistics at the Praslin airport are very simple, but still full-featured.

The flight only takes 15 minutes but offers fantastic views of especially Praslin island. It also very handy to switch from the domestic to the international "terminals" at Mahe, so it does work to save time using this option of transport.

Try to have as little hand luggage as possible, you need to keep it in your lap or under the seat in front of you. There is no overhead room or other handluggage space in the cabin.

When arriving at Mahe, the luggage is delivered right inside the terminal door in a very small spot not clearly marked. Can be a bit confusing.

All in all a positive experience, but a bit expensive (about double the mimimum price of the ferry).

Then down the corridor, only to be held up for another period for some unexplained reason, then to the entrance of the aircraft, where again another apparently unexplained delay before boarding. Seat was comfortable but one third of the leg room space is taken up with the IFE 'box' and on an A.320, this means cramped! Flight should have been on the more spacious A.330 but it was not to be. After 40 minutes into the flight I asked a stewardess why the IFE had not been started - she replied that this was due to a 'Passenger Announcement'. Does she think we frequent travellers (some 50 years!) can be convinced by such a nonsensical statement? It was an hour before the IFE was made available. There is simply no excuse for this on what is a five hour flight. With a small/tiny screen in the seat back, it was almost impossible for me, even with glasses, to read the tiny script or, even, the names of the films! Not good. After all this, I was in a thoroughly irritable mood - only to have this lifted by a surprisingly good meal and excellent drinks service. With no other airline serving this route directly, one is stuck with Air Seychelles but with more training and a commitment to on time flights etc., this would have been a reasonably good flight. Overall, disappointed!
crvsd: Michael L wrote a review Jan 2018
qwuub: Late to arrive, even later/longer to depart, otherwise mixed views!

Title:
I booked a flight with Air Seychelles in January 2017 from Frankfurt to Antananarivo to visit a friend. The first flight was 1st of August, the second 1st of November.

On the 14th of July I received an E-Mail with a cancelation of my flight to Tana. As reason Air Seychelles named the cooperation with Ethihad has been canceled and so is my flight. There was no effort to offer me another flight or to contact me via phone. I had to call their hotline and persisted on taking that flight. After 15 minutes I had back my initial flight with stops in Abu Dhabi and Seychelles.

For the flight back I received another cancelation at the 20th of August for my 16 hours return flight with stops in the Seychelles (Mahe) and Abu Dhabi. This time the reason is the Pest in Madagaskar and the risk for the people living on the Seychelles. There was a case of Pest recorded on the Seychelles. Anyways other Airlines still have a direct connection between Antananarivo and Mahe (Seychelles) which makes me doubt about the usefullness of the cancelation.
Also this time there was no attempt to offer me another flight. They e-mailed me and thats it. I had to call again and asked for another flight.
I got offered a 32 hours flight with a night in Mauritius, Stops at Seychelles and Abu Dhabi. This is far off from what I initially booked. The woman on the phone assured me that this is my best option. So I sayed ok to the changed booking. After that I checked on the Internet and found a direct flight from Air Madagaskar to the Seychelles with which I could have kept my initial schedule. Air Madagaskar is in the Vanilla Alliance with Air Seychelles. So a booking would have been possible. I called the hotline again and asked for the flight with Air Madagaskar to the Seychelles. I was told that I already changed my flight once and that another change would cost several hundred dollars. So I ended up with a flight that takes double the time of my initial flight with a stop at Mauritius at 2 a.m. in the night and a one day later arrival at my destination.

While calling the hotline I got disconnected several times when I asked uncomfortable questions.

This is my last flight with Air Seychelles.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Outward flight from Manchester operated on behalf of Air Seychelles by Etihad went without incident. The return flight from mauritius by Air Seychelles, different story and turned out to be a nightmare!!!!!!
After boarding we found out the plane was being diverted to Madagascar to deliver a spare tyre of all things (surely they could have thought of a better excuse!). As a result the flight arrived late in Seychelles and we missed our connecting flight to Manchester.
They arranged for us to fly to Paris instead with the promise that all appropriate arrangements would be made for us to fly from Paris to Manchester.
However when we arrive in Paris we were sent from counter to counter, finally we were told by Air France (who Air Seychelles had said they were booking our flight with) that no connecting flight had been arranged, leaving us stranded in Paris.
We were told to liase with Air Seychelles counter outside the transit area, after leaving transit and reaching the Terminal 2C we were told by the information desk the Air Seychelles counter had closed months ago, leaving us worried and anxious we were now outside the transit area without our baggage. We were given a contact number for Air Seychelles office in Paris, to further add to the nightmare the office was shut as it was a Saturday! Leaving us with no choice but to ring Air Seychelles office in Seychelles at an enormous cost to us, at least 3 times to arrange a connection between Paris and Manchester.
We then had to plead with Security to collect our luggage from within the transit area and make a dash across the airport to another terminal to check in for our onward journey, making it exhausted but just in the nick of time.
To make matters worse, after contacting Air Seychelles when we got home to complain about our experience we are still waiting for a response a week later!
After this experience I would not recommend Air Seychelles to anyone! Totally disorganised and unhelpful!!
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
This was just a short hop return flight between the islands of Mahe and Praslin.
The DHC-6Twin Otter aircraft used for this flight are fairly small (around 20 seats) but never the less are operated just as professionaly as larger airlines and the staff are friendly and helpful. Admittedly, the seating layout is tight and the turbo prop engines are pretty noisy but this is only to be expected in this type of aircraft. Nervous flyers could possibly find the flight quite challenging due to the fact that it flies fairly low over the sea because of the short journey time. Reassuringly, this is a very reliable aircraft despite its size and the aircrew were very professional in their approach to the flight.
This 15 minute flight is an alternative to a 1 hour ferry journey and would be my personal choice, though the ferry fare may be cheaper. I really enjoyed these flights, which gave a great view of the island coastlines and surrounding reefs and I would recommend the flights to anyone wanting to visit Praslin Island whilst in the Seychelles.

Title:
My review is based on experiences regarding intercontinental (D√ºsseldorf - Mahe and back), African (Mahe to Antananarivo and back) and domestic flights (Mahe - Praslin - Mahe). It was a very mixed experience, with more negative elements than positive altogether.
We have booked our flights to Madagascar 6 months earlier, exactly because of the short connection time in Mahe. 3 weeks before the flight I got an email saying that our connection to Antananarivo was cancelled for that day, we have to spend a night in the Seychelles and take next day's flight. After complaining, they promised to book us a night in the Savoy hotel at Beau Vallon beach. Instead, we were brought to Eden Bleu hotel upon arrival, which is close to the airport, but far away from the beach. We didn't have any idea where we were until it was too late, so they didn't keep their promise.
The flight from D√ºsseldorf was very pleasant, by the way. About 2/3 of the seats were empty, so there was plenty of space for everyone and we got good service. On the way back, the situation was completely different. The flight was much more full, it took forever until they finally served food, they kept the light on for too long, so it was impossible to sleep, also breakfast was way too early. In the evening it was too hot in the airplane, they didn't reduce temperature until a passenger got sick and they started asking for a doctor. Service was terrible, you had to fight for drinks. In the morning I asked for tea and got coffee. After I realized the mistake, I asked for tea again, the stewardess refused. The staff was generally not polite at all. Food and in-flight entertainment were, however, surprisingly good. I enjoyed the fish curry. There was a wide range of movies and music to choose from. Seat comfort and legroom were average in economy.
Also on the flights to and from Madagascar, service was bad. They had tea, coffee, water etc. when collecting the dishes / garbage after lunch, but they never offered it. This resulted many passengers having to walk to the kitchen to ask for drinks. The in-flight entertainment didn't work on the flight to Antananarivo at all, but it did on the way back.
The best were the short domestic flights to and from Praslin - not much space, but safe flights, not much to go wrong during such a short time. We were even allowed to take all our luggage for free (3 pieces, even though originally the booking stated only 2 of 20 kg - our luggage was around 60 kg altogether). However, also here they cancelled our original flight and put us on a later one, which was late - it seems to be a very common practice with Air Seychelles. So think about this when planning your flight home, it can be a problem if you don't have enough time (4 hours between domestic and international flight were safe in our case).
Altogether, it wasn't a pleasant experience using this airline, it caused lots of unnecessary stress and I'll definitely try to fly with another company should I travel to this part of the world again.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
Air Seychelles was on the path to being one of the best airlines in Africa or perhaps the best... with the support and management of Etihad. But since Etihad handed it back to local management, Air Seychelles has dropped its standards and would be a typical 'african' airline. The flights are almost always delayed, especially the flight leaving the Seychelles in the mornings.
It is hard to imagine what the reasons are but often we would notice that the plane is still being loaded with cargo and the attitude and mannerism shown by ground staff would indicate a very relaxed, no hurry style.
I would suggest that people consider flying Emirates... cleaner plane, better food and on time with 3 flights into the Seychelles daily.
I'm an Etihad frequent flyer but have lost respect for the airline that they 'in essence' have taken over....
crvsd: Jasmine V wrote a review Jul 2017

Title: Of the eight times we have flown to Seychelles and back, this was definitely the worst. The basic necessities were hard to come by. We have never had to deal with the amount of body odour and the filthy toilets were completely unacceptable. Many seats were broken as well as seat pockets, TV set adjustments etc. The cabin crew ( with the exception of one or two) were surly and unhelpful. The air conditioning was set on freezing and asking for a blanket was like asking for a pint of blood. We received one two hours after first asking. Pressing the bell was like shouting into the wind. We were completely ignored. Many passengers needed special diets which took up a lot of time, but then, while the rest of us were served, they still demanded attention. We had to wait for the main dishes and the kids were crumpled and open. The overall experience was awful. It was by far the worst flight we've had in many years. The plane itself looked as if it was heading for the scrap heap - we just hoped the engine and instruments were in better shape than the rest.

Title:
We flew Air Seychelles to Cape Town via JNB. First thing. If a flight is late into Seychelles ALL flights are delayed so the people can connect so I expect flights a late a lot.
Second, don't expect much food on flights. Our flight to JNB left at 11am and all we got was a light breakfast. It's a 5 hour flight and we were hungry.
Third and most of all, we missed our connecting Cape Town flight (booked with air seychelles flight number) because of leaving Seychelles late. We were met at the gate on arrival and I thought this would be fixed up with minimum hassle. It was not. Long story short, we went back and forth between the Air Seychelles ticket office and check in for domestic flights 4 times (and they are opposite ends of airport) trying to get on aflight to Cape Town.
The Air Seychelles staff would tell us we were booked on next flight, we would get to the check in and we wouldn't be booked in properly and then we would have to repeat. By the fourth time, the last flight to cape town was about to leave and we had to pay 7000 rand to get tickets on it.
The staff at Air Seychelles were terrible to us. They would not answer questions and would ignore any. They would swear we were booked but then not be surprised when we got back to them saying they weren't but still wouldn't help in a timely manner.
All this was made worse by the fact we have three kids including an infant. We were literally all crying as we were unable to eat other than the light breakfast on the first flight because we had to keep running back and forth to try to get the flights. They did not care at all.
we were not the only ones effected. They even gave boarding passes for connecting flights to people hopping of the first flight that did not work and the people owuld find out they needed to pay when they tried to board!!
It was an absolute joke. I have complained but can't get any response.
We travel a lot and have never had such a terrible experience.
qwuub: Worst Airline. Cross Your Fingers Nothing Goes Wrong As They Won't Help

Title:
We had our return journey from Seychelles to Mumbai also on this airline. With an infant, we had to ask for priority check in and the ground staff accepted it but rather reluctantly. There was one single counter for Business class and priority check in with infants or for senior citizens.
When we reached, one lady was checking in the priority counter and there was a long queue on economy counter and check in was taking long time for a family whom we saw leaving the hotel more than half an hour before us. We asked for priority check in and the ground staff asked to wait in the economy queue and see if that's faster than the other counter. My husband was waiting on the queue for general counter and I was standing on the priority counter and the lady actually quipped that I can wait on the other queue and still check in.
Of course, the priority counter was free first and we checked in there and they just gave us boarding pass for middle row which was not having the extra leg room for infant. Again, we asked for it and then the lady in counter ran to stop the baggage, change the baggage tag, boarding pass and we were set.
This flight was also delayed by few minutes and the boarding started just 5 minutes before the scheduled departure. On boarding gate they asked me to fold the stroller and hand over to them, I didn't get the reason as generally I take the stroller till the flight. As it was a small walk, I followed and handed over the stroller. Faced the problem in Mumbai, the stroller was not handed over to us after de-boarding from the flight and we had to carry the baby along with the hand luggage for quite a distanace. The stroller was also delayed in baggage belt, we got it very late. Even in domestic flights, I hand over the stroller just before stepping into the flight and get it after stepping out from the flight. This was not expected from an international carrier.
This time also they served one meal, dinner, the food was neither tasty nor sufficient for dinner.

Title:
I selected Air Seychelles as they offered direct flight for Seychelles from Mumbai. We were travelling with an infant but were still not provided priority check in. We were not in a hurry and hence didn't ask for it but generally with other airlines, we didn't have to ask for it. Here, actually they asked if we were travelling Business Class and then guided us to the normal economy class queue instead of priority queue.
Flight was a bit delayed, for boarding we asked for priority boarding and got it. It was of 4.5 hours duration, we got the front row seats having extra leg space as we were travelling with infant. Seats were comfortable. They serve only one meal during the 4.5 hrs flight, it was a breakfast, just ok kind. In all airlines, I had traveled before, Juice/soft drink/hard drink was provided as a pre/with meal option and tea/coffee as post meal option. Here it was not, all options were provided together, with meal. I still thought that they would come back with tea/coffee later but they didn't.
My daughter was sleeping most of the time and woke up crying but didn't accept any food that we offered. They provided a tray with some dessert, fruit plate and bread-butter-jam which she had.
We reached almost on the time though it started a bit late.

Title:
I take carrier with which I choose to get to my destination very serious and having flown with some of the leading airlines in the world, I decided to travel with Air Seychelles, since it has a direct flight from Johannesburg. The flight to Seychelles was okay-ish, but the return flight was a total nightmare. The return flight (HM 61 on Sunday 02 April 2017) saw the Cabin Crew showing a total disregard for passengers by blatantly ignoring them. In short they spoiled what otherwise would have been an amazing trip to their beautiful country. They were abrupt, unfriendly, lacked service ethic and most of all, ignored passengers. Mid-way through the flight, I activated the service light and for more than five minutes, I sat waiting, with not a single Cabin Crew in sight. I got up from my seat and saw various other passengers with service lights activated. I finally got up and decided to use the lavatory upon which I proceeded to the back of the plane, where to my amazement I found the crew gathered in the back chatting. What I assumed was a bathroom in the back of the plane turned out to be the crew galley or pantry and when I enquired about the whereabouts of the lavatory, I was pointed by finger to find my way to the centre of the plane. Upon my return to my seat I found them still seated in the back and my service light de-activated. I activated it again. After what seemed like hours, someone finally came and it felt like an inconvenience for them.

I will definitely not recommend Air Seychelles to anyone in the Travel and Tourism sector and personally I would rather fly half way around the world to connect with a different carrier to get me to Seychelles. Instead of flying the Seychellois flag for they beautiful country, the impertinence and disrespect does much damage to the gem in the Indian Ocean and leave their brand image scarred. Perhaps they should do what Qatar and Emirates does and recruit international crew from around the globe, since their own could not be bothered to align themselves to the brand they¬¥re representing.

Title:
I don't know where to begin with this airline. From the very beginning when we were waiting for our check-in at the terminal in Mumbai, we got a feel of the inefficiency of the staff. Air Seychelles is a partner airline with Etihad and I'm shocked at the level of service offered. At check-in, there were no separate counters classified for passengers travelling to Abu Dhabi and the Seychelles. Instead, passengers were mixed up and we wanted more leg room and asked if we could get an aisle seat. We were offered the seats at the emergency exits and had to pay extra by the Etihad staff. We thought it was fair since the leg room would be better. Little did we know what we had in store for us once we got into the aircraft.

Instead of boarding passengers in batches - senior citizens, guests with children, Business Class and seat numbers in that order, we were called in random numbers when nothing was smooth and it took us 45 minutes of solid waiting in queue to get inside the damn aircraft. We were tired, sleep-deprived and needless to say, running awfully short of patience.

Once inside the aircraft we discovered there was no leg room as we dreamt of. The luggage was not handled properly, the overhead cabins were teeming with cabin bags of all shapes and sizes. Even our slot was taken up by someone else. The food was nothing to write home about and neither was the service.

Our nightmare didnt end there. When we reached Mahe, after we were kept waiting for over 25 mins at the luggage belt, we were told by the staff that our luggage is still in Mumbai and the airline couldn't bring it over because they exceeded the weight limitations. We were told that they would be delivered to us hopefully within the next 24 hours. That meant spending another hour filling out our addresses and details on plain A4 sized papers. As tourists and guests, we were NEVER told what the airline would do to compensate for the money we spent on a change of clothes, a toothbrush and other essentials. What was worst was one of the Business Class passengers promptly received his luggage and happily trotted out of the airport. The rest of us were kept waiting like refugees. The staff were taking their own sweet time to answer questions and chatting and joking among themselves when irate and anxious passengers were left struggling, trying to call their travel agents not knowing what to do without their luggage. Grossly indifferent and negligent ground staff at Mahe airport. The next day, thankfully, we received our luggage (during which time we spent our own money and brought clothes from a store at the hotel that would get us through the day) - this is not compensated for by the airline TILL NOW. Upon looking at the baggage tag, we realized that our bags made a sojourn all the way from India to Abu Dhabi and then made its way to the Seychelles. I was told some guests don't receive their luggage until 2-3 days and some don't receive it at all! Thinking of them, I felt we were in a better situation.

Our return flight from Mahe airport in the Seychelles to Mumbai was no different. The check-in counters are manned by staff who think they are doing us a favour by talking to us.Arrogant, indifferent and impolite. Why can't Air Seychelles employ someone who speaks and knows Hindi as a language considering most passengers are labourers who cannot speak English or French? And also since most passengers are Indians?!

Coming to the most shocking part - my husband and I were sitting at the emergency exit row. We were given the aisle and middle seats. Picture this - there was no safety briefing on how the lady sitting at the window would handle the situation, had there been an emergency landing!!!! Atrocious! No willingness asked for, no permissions taken. Somewhere during the journey, i realized my leg hit something metallic. Upon inspection, i found it was a loose electrical circuit plug lingering around freely along with the several plastic containers that people had dropped on the ground. Thankfully I didnt get an electric shock. Just one word - GROSS NEGLIGENCE. I should have taken a picture but I was too tired to even move.

Lastly, the crew were very very slow and indifferent to passengers' plea for a drink of water. Am not sure what went on in the pantry but this was shocking. We don't pay this kind of money even if we're Economy passengers to be given this kind of shoddy treatment. An airline of supposed repute like Etihad should take note.

There was no information regarding which belt in Mumbai airport would carry our luggage. We had to fend for ourselves. I was just thankful that we made it to Mumbai safely and was praying desperately for the luggage to arrive. Well that took another 20 minutes of waiting, but we did get our luggage.

WILL NEVER FLY THIS AIRLINE AGAIN IF WE CAN HELP IT. TERRIBLE, JUST TERRIBLE.
crvsd: Vidya S wrote a review Jan 2017
qwuub: Gross violation of in-flight safety,extremely indifferent and incompetent staff just pathetic!

Title:
We had the worst air travel experience with Air Seychelles, flying from Tana, Madagascar to Kathmandu, Nepal on 11/4/2016. We had two transfers - Mahe and Mumbai. We were treated like illegal immigrants (or worst) and forced to stay at the airport overnight because the ignorant supervisor on ground in Mahe, Seychelles.

We flew from Tana to Mahe. When we arrived Mahe, they refused to issue us boarding passes for our next two connections (Mahe-Mumbai-KTM) because we did not have onward tickets after Nepal. We explained to them that we are backpackers. We travel by land mostly and plan to cross the boarder by car from Nepal to India. The supervisor told us she will check and disappeared. When we asked about our flight, she said we still have time and she will not leave us behind.

We waited in the airport until 9:10pm when our connection flight to Mumbai was boarding. By that time, we've purchased our onward ticket from KTM to Delhi as we cannot afford to miss the flight. We showed our ticket to one of the staffs. The first thing she told us is we cannot boarding our flight because the gate is closed!! Then when she phoned the supervisor, the supervisor demanded to see our INDIA VISA, which was completely irrelevant. We waited there thinking the supervisor will come back to us, but they just let us missed the flight like that! Even after we had all the documents they asked for!

In the end, the supervisor never showed up and they did not let us board our flight even though we had the onward tickets. We were dumped in the airport without any explanation. We did not know why we need to show the airline our India visa while we are just flying to Nepal and what should we do for the flights that we've missed.

When the supervisor showed up around midnight, she said we will have to wait for the next day to rearrange the tickets and just disappeared again. They tried to send us to a hotel but it was too late, the immigration officer didn't let us pass. Therefore, we were forced to sleep in the airpot. None of Air Seychelles' staffs asked if we have food, water or blanket. They just all left and dumped us there like we were some kind of illegal immigrations or refuges!!

After a night in the airport. On 11/5, we spoke with numerous of their staffs about our issue, including the supervisors and duty managers. None of them helped. They either pushed us around or said they will check and disappeared. I told them I need to take medicines, which is in my big bag that they'd kept my bag in their office. The lady I spoke said she will take it for me and never showed up. What if I have a serious condition and I would just die without my medicines?? None of Air Seychelles' staffs cared about their customers.

In the end, we were able to board the flight on 11/5 with EXACTLY THE SAME DOCUMENTS we had a night before, which means we could've boarded our original flight!!! We did not need to sleep at the airport and we did not need to go through this mental and physical torture!!!

Two things that i learned about this airline 1) they have unprofessional and unqualified supervisor that does not have the knowledge of basic airline policy, or rather, common senses of air travel ; 2) their staffs cannot care less about their customers. It's never their business and they will never try to help, never!
qwuub: Forced to miss the flight and sleep in the airport because their ignorant staff!!TERRIBLE!!

Title: We were scheduled  to fly by this airline on 21st September, 2016 from Johannesburg to Mumbai. When we reached the airport , we were informed that the flight was delayed by one hour. Instead of 13.45 it will depart at 14.45. On the gate there was no announcement, and the boarding did not commence till 15.15. The process commenced but we were not allowed to board the flight. Then we were once again asked to sit near the gate. The boarding commenced at 15.55. We were seated in the heated plane as the A.C. was not working. We were informed that we will be on the way in next 15 minutes. Nothing happened. At 16.45 they informed us that due to some technical snag, it may take another 30 minutes. We disembarked from the plane at 17.00 hrs. We waited for another hour. No refreshments were served. Not even water. No one offered any explanation. At 18.00 hrs. on hue and cry someone said that we will be told the fate of our flight in 20 mins. Nothing till 18.45. Suddenly at 19.15 they informed that flight was cancelled. What was to be done was never said. Some passengers started towards immigration and others followed. Our baggage was supposed to come and we waited till 20.3 for it to come. Once again , we learnt from other passengers that we were to be taken to a Hotel and the baggage would come there. From where , which hotel , next day's plans : nothing was announced. We ultimately checked into a nearby hotel by 21.15 , totally exhausted. After the dinner, at around 22.30 we were informed that we should assemble at 7.00 a.m to be transferred to Airport. Once again no flight details. In the morning we grouped to gather and ultimately boarded an Etihaad flight to Abu Dhabi at 10.15. Ultimately we heaved a sigh a relief but , the airline was not informed about the food preference of the passengers and we being vegetarians, did not get vegetarian meals. Anyway poor management, poor communication left a bad taste in the mouth. Though they arranged for the hotel stay and dinner but it was without their commitment, only by compulsion and no one from the airline was there to redress our grievance.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title: I wanted to bring to your attention the pathetic experience I have recently had flying Air Seychelles and its partner Etihad on the Mumbai-Dar Es Salaam-Mumbai route. I had booked an confirmed Air Seychelles flight Mumbai-Male-Dar-Mumbai (PNR:JY4MS) on January 2016 for flying in July 2016. A month later we were informed that Air Seychelles has stopped flying that route and has shifted us to Etihad flight via Abu Dhabi (PNR:NXCBKX). I had confirmed with the Mumbai office of Air Seychelles and the flight was confirmed. A week before flying I checked with Etihad online and they informed me that my Abu Dhabi-Dar es Salaam sector was not confirmed. Neither Air Seychelles nor Etihad had taken the effort to inform me of this situation inspite of purchasing a confirmed ticket in January! If I had not followed up I would have been stranded in Abu Dhabi. The Air Seychelles ground office in Mumbai was equally clueless. Repeated emails from them to Air Seychelles and Etihad (on highest priority I was told) went unanswered. Only after I threatened to take Air Seychelles and Etihad to consumer court did they swing into action and book us on Kenyan Airways. As a gesture we were informed that a special request for upgradation to Business class has been put but ofcourse as expected there was no record on the system during check in. Also the complimentary chauffer service from Etihad was not available as the PNR was 'not registered' in the system. The only explanation that I was offered was 'a system glitch'. This is highly irresponsible of both Air Seychelles and Etihad. I will definitely not be flying either airlines and will actively inform as many as I can to be wary of both these third-class operators. I would rather pay more and go by a more reliable airlines like Emirates or Qatar Airways. Both Etihad and Air Seychelles promise a lot but once the money is exchanged forget your responsibility.

Title:
We choose Air Seychelles for our trip to India between March and April this yea. Being competitive in price and with hop over in Seychelles the trip was all set for great experience.The trip to..from Mauritius to Mumbai was fine.
However return was not the same. We arrive to check-in at Mumbai and there was no representative for airlines and they have only three counters checking in for flight.
Finally our turn to check in came. I had 75 kilo luggage for three check in passenger and one hand bag per person as per limit however I was travelling back with clay Tabla (musical instrument). I kept it back with me as hand luggage knowing its fragile and could be broken in checked in. We did the same in all internal flight in India.
The staff at counter and supervisor and shift both refused saying that its not possible we argued over 30 minutes and at last have to accept to put it in luggage. Sarcastically enough they said they cary glass,tv and all in checkin so its just a tabla.
We arrived at Mauritius and opened the bag at airport..as expected the set was broken...we were sad and shocked..we looked around for Air seychelles staff at airport again there was no one from airline and was asked to speak to airmauritius luggage services we spoke to lady on counter reported a broken delsey suitcass and tabla..she took the request and said team will get in touch..for two weeks there was no follow up we called the same reply wait some one will get in touch.
After a month we lost all patience and took both and went to there office in portlouise. They were surprised that we reported it after a month..but still logged in the complaint and said will take care..we waited for three long weeks to be told a fraction of ticketing policy stating " airlines is not responsible for breakage of item inside luggage"
They denied to repay for exchange of the peice broken by mishandling of their ground handleling agent and there rudeness.
Asking to get contact for higher management was never reverted either and office in mauritius is on for show as they can't decide a simple case of luggage mishandling .

Last to advise all vegetarian guest travelling from India be warned about No or pathetic v9eg food and menu in flight ...so prepare yourself well or take alternative airlines......shame on airline which boast to be 5 star......

Title: We were booked on this flight by our Agent -Thomas Cook India, as part of a package deal to Mauritius. But the ordeal began as soon as we checked in at 2.05 am for a flight at 5.00 am to Mahe and then to Mauritius. There was no web check in facility and its Mumbai office told that the airport counter will open 3 hours before, while it actually opened 4 hours before. So, by the time we were there, all seats were full and counter person was not giving us two seats side by side. With great difficulty, we could get two aisle seats in same row up to Mahe. From Mahe, he again allotted us seats 8 rows apart and asked us to try for change of seats at Mahe, as they had different softwares. But on reaching Mahe, the officials flatly refused and we had to travel 8 rows apart. In fact, my wife gave her seat to another newly married couple so that at least they may go together. While coming, we made sure to reach early at the airports and could luckily get the two seats together both the times in 9th row ( up to Mahe)  and 19th row (from Mahe to Mumbai). I think that Seychelles Air can do much better job by planning it well, esp. when they know before hand that passengers are mostly Honeymooning couples and that flights are full! In today's times, Web Check in is the least they can do!The food was good but service by hostesses was run of the mill. The water to me was served almost one hour despite the request light being on for full hour. No arrangement for water or charging of phones at Mahe Airport are big lacunae in travelling  with Air Seychelles. The timings of travel are very odd. You are sapped of your energy by the time you land or fly. Hope officials take note of above problems and do something to improve passenger experience in future.

However,  Etihad bought a stake in Air Seychelles and practically runs it, meaning that most flight from Abu Dhabi to Seychelles are operated by Air Seychelles. Air Seychelles claims to be awarded Indian Ocean‚Äôs Leading Airline - Business Class. Great, but there are not that many airlines to complete against. The fleet is not so good, planes are leased and they have seen better times. What does gets on my nerves is the crew and the announcements. They talk  A LOT! crew always chatting, even during the night flights, you can hear them gossiping at the back. When the announcements come, they repeat them in French, English, Creole, sometimes in Arabic and sometimes even in Chinese. If yo want to sleep, forget it, they will keep telling you to buy duty free and fasten seatbelts throughout the flight, in 3 languages at least!
